variables.description: Number of children of race [race] and gender [gender] with non-missing data used to construct the estimate for [outcome]  Mean weekly hours child worked in the 12 months before they were surveyed (among children who received ACS at age 30+) = hours worked per week * weeks worked in [year] / 51, where 51 is the maximum “weeks” worked in the ACS (since top bin is 50-52). = 0 (for those who do not work)

variables.name: hs_[race]_[gender]_n
variables.description: Number of children of race [race] and gender [gender] with non-missing data used to construct the estimate for [outcome]  Fraction of children who completed high school or obtained a GED (among children who the ACS or 2000 long form at age 19+)

variables.name: kfr_imm_[race]_[gender]_n
variables.description: Number of children of race [race] and gender [gender] with non-missing data used to construct the estimate for [outcome]  Baseline kfr measure (2014-15 income) defined above, but restricted to children whose mothers immigrated to the United States (according to ACS or Census 2000 long form)

variables.name: kfr_native_[race]_[gender]_n
variables.description: Number of children of race [race] and gender [gender] with non-missing data used to construct the estimate for [outcome]  Baseline kfr measure (2014-15 income) defined above, but restricted to children whose mothers were born in the United States (according to ACS or Census 2000 long form)

variables.name: kir_imm_[race]_[gender]_n
variables.description: Number of children of race [race] and gender [gender] with non-missing data used to construct the estimate for [outcome]  Baseline kir measure (2014-15 income) defined above, but restricted to children whose mothers immigrated to the United States (according to ACS or Census 2000 long form)

variables.name: kir_native_[race]_[gender]_n
variables.description: Number of children of race [race] and gender [gender] with non-missing data used to construct the estimate for [outcome]  Baseline kir measure (2014-15 income) defined above, but restricted to children whose mothers were born in the United States (according to ACS or Census 2000 long form)

variables.name: pos_hours_[race]_[gender]_n
variables.description: Number of children of race [race] and gender [gender] with non-missing data used to construct the estimate for [outcome]  Fraction of children with positive hours worked in the 12 months before being surveyed (among children who received the ACS at age 30+)

variables.name: proginc_[race]_[gender]_n
variables.description: Number of children of race [race] and gender [gender] with non-missing data used to construct the estimate for [outcome]  Fraction of children who receive public assistance income (among children who received the ACS at age 30+)

variables.name: somecoll_[race]_[gender]_n
variables.description: Number of children of race [race] and gender [gender] with non-missing data used to construct the estimate for [outcome]  Fraction of children having at least some college experience (among children who received the ACS or 2000 long form at age 25+)

variables.name: wgflx_rk_[race]_[gender]_n
variables.description: Number of children of race [race] and gender [gender] with non-missing data used to construct the estimate for [outcome]  Hourly wage rank, computed within child birth year and year of ACS receipt (among children who received the ACS at age 30+) = annual labor income / (weekly hours worked * weeks worked per year) = missing for those who do not work

variables.name: par_rank_[race]_[gender]_mean
variables.description: Mean household income rank for parents of children of race [race] and gender [gender]. Parents are ranked relative to other parents with children in the same birth cohort (averaged over 1994-1995 and 1998-2000)

variables.name: par_rank_[race]_[gender]_mean_se
variables.description: Estimated standard error for par_rank_[race]_[gender]_mean

variables.name: kid_[race]_[gender]_n
variables.description: Count of children under 18 of race [race] and gender [gender] in the tract in 2000 (from publicly available 2000 Decennial Census data)

variables.name: frac_below_median_[race]_[gender]
variables.description: Fraction of children with parents who have income below the national median for parents with children in the same birth cohort. Children are weighted by the total number of childhood years spent in the tract.

variables.name: kid_[race]_[gender]_blw_p50_n
variables.description: Number of children under 18 living in the given tract with parents whose household income was below the national median. This is computed by multiplying the number of children living in the tract according to the 2000 Decennial Census (kid_[race]_[gender]_n) by the fraction of children living in households in which the parents earn less than the national median  in the relevant analysis sample (frac_below_median_[race]_[gender]). We use this variable as our preferred population weighting variable when analyzing these outcomes across places

variables.name: frac_years_xw_[race]_[gender]
variables.description: Mean fraction of possible childhood years (up to age 23) children spent in this tract. This is calculated over children who spent any time in this tract.

outcomes.name: has_dad
outcomes.description: Fraction of children who have a male claimer in the year they are linked to parents

outcomes.name: has_mom
outcomes.description: Fraction of children who have a female claimer in the year they are linked to parents

outcomes.name: jail
outcomes.description: Fraction incarcerated on April 1st, 2010 (where incarceration is defined as residing in a federal detention center, federal prison, state prison, local jail, residential correctional facility, military jail, or juvenile correctional facility)

outcomes.name: kfr
outcomes.description: Mean percentile rank (relative to other children born in the same year) in the national distribution of household income (i.e. own earnings and spouse’s earnings) measured as mean earnings in 2014-2015 for the baseline sample

outcomes.name: kfr_stycz
outcomes.description: Baseline kfr measure (2014-15 income) as defined above, but restricted to children who live in one of their childhood commuting zones in adulthood

outcomes.name: kfr_top01
outcomes.description: Probability of reaching the top 1% of the national household income distribution (among children born in the same year) in 2014-15

outcomes.name: kfr_top20
outcomes.description: Probability of reaching the top quintile of the national household income distribution (among children born in the same year) in 2014-15

outcomes.name: kfr_[age]
outcomes.description: Mean percentile rank (relative to other children in the same year) in the national distribution of household income measured at [age] 24, 26, and 29

outcomes.name: kir
outcomes.description: Mean percentile rank (relative to other children born in the same year) in the national distribution of individual income (i.e. just own earnings) measured as mean earnings in 2014-2015 for the baseline sample

outcomes.name: kir_stycz

outcomes.name: kir_top01

outcomes.name: kir_top20
outcomes.description: Probability of reaching the top quintile of the national individual income distribution (among children born in the same year) in 2014-15

outcomes.name: kir_[age]

outcomes.name: lpov_nbh
